p: State average field workability projections show increases under A1B and A2 for late March and early April compared to baseline ( Fig 4). Across the state and under all scenarios, the number of FWDs available in April and May either remains similar to the baseline period or decreases ( Fig 3). For B1 and A1B, decreases in the number of April to May FWDs are expected across much of the state. Under A2, the average number of April to May FWDs shows a sharp decrease in the West Southwest district and a small decrease in the West district, but little change elsewhere.
